body: It depends. The java agent provides the optional feature. Read `correlation.auto_tag_keys` here, should be clear for you, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#table-of-agent-configuration-properties
I don't know what do you mean about this.
Same issue here. Any timeline to fix this bug? thanks very much.
Do you write your own plugin? I can't see the codes of SkyWalking official plugin.
Look like tests fail, please recheck or rerun.
please update `docs/en/FAQ/kafka-plugin.md` and `docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md`
thanks，it works.

> Do you write your own plugin? I can't see the codes of SkyWalking official plugin.

Did not write any plug-ins by myself, adopted the official 8.1.0 version of plug-ins, and did not make any changes
We need your help to locate the issue. Our tests have been provided and passed.
So, which interceptor reported the exception? I can't find `Jetcd` in our supported list doc.

**2020-11-23 Review**
**Questions & Discussion:**

1. How to support the http receiver?
2. What are the strategies for file creation and deletion?
3. What is the detail of the committed offset?
4. Put the offsets of the batch data into FlyingChannel rather than a copy.
5. SLO of the resources.
6. How about reusing files in Queue?
7. Daemonset Or Sidecar ?
8. Whether indexing files will cost more resources?

> Supported-list.md should be updated to indicate which versions should be tested.

Changed. Pls have a check.

> please update `docs/en/FAQ/kafka-plugin.md` and `docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md`

Added.
It is just an experimental feature. Don't recommend end user to try.
but can we try the experimental feature
what's the largest scale and latency for micro services now skywalking used?
If you want that, check and try that as a developer. We don't touch those codes for a long time.
thanks, but how to enable opentracing feature in skywalking and combined with popular opentracing tools in skywalking?
What do you mean popular opentracing tool in SkyWalking? We don't have concepts like that.

sorry my bad, i mean since skywalking claims support for open tracing , is there any integration example for skywalking agent plus opentracing server except skywalking collector like jaeger or other stuff?
This is unreasonable question. How could we know that. As an open source community, we can't and shouldn't touch users env, and product data, which are user privacy.
sorry, i mean is there any successful example about large scale skywalking

Simple answer, we don't. We don't say we support ot without condition. If you want Jaeger ecosystem, go to their repo please. It doesn't make sense to keep asking here about another project. It is their responsibility, not ours.
We have this, https://skywalking.apache.org/blog/2020-08-11-observability-at-scale/

sorry and thanks for your quick feedback!
personally I like skywalking very much but needs some comparison about other system, for now I am using 6.6 since 8.x not working on my env complaining collector not up and try figuring out can skywalking support over hundred microservices with heavy payload. 
The reason I am asking jaeger is what they claimed good support about k8s in the doc but I never succeeded following it.
Btw is the java agent universal for all ( zipkin etc, collector)
thanks, this is what I need! do we have benchmark saying for what kind of computing resource to support the amount of tracing or number of java micro services so that we could extend it horizontally

2 things, one, 6 is not recommended. And most users have upgraded to 8 as it has much better performance and more maintainability. Then, Jeager and Zipkim have their communities and ecosystems, both of them are not SkyWalking responsibility anyway, no matter tech itself. The open source projects are driven by their contributors, currently, we don't have people working on that.Also, we can't tell others performance, as they are not experts about them.

thanks and I found this https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/Agent-Benchmarks, hope it helps!
also I am thinking about since open tracing is just a spec that means technically everybody following same format should be able to communicate with each other

No, it isn't a spec. It never is. I am a member of open tracing, trust me, it is far from a spec. OpenTracing actually is being merged into OpenTelemetry, very little people use it than you thought. Please don't read a doc and believe it. Do some research before have conclusion. 
More importantly, OpenTracing doesn't have format, never, it is just an API layer. Read the thing and understand the thing you bring up.
We wouldn't and shouldn't continue on talking a thing doesn't relate and matter to SkyWalking much.
Do your own research rather than just asking. Your research and your conclusion should not depend on us.
No, we don't. We provided document.
Please update the changelog.

> So, which interceptor reported the exception? I can't find `Jetcd` in our supported list doc.

From the current point of view, the springboot framework is used, and the interceptor of the spring plugin is entered.

Yes, but it is not related. This exception is from an exit span, which is tracing client side rpc, Spring interceptor is for server side mostly.

> Yes, but it is not related. This exception is from an exit span, which is tracing client side rpc, Spring interceptor is for server side mostly.

It is exit span, jetcd here is called in the normal main thread, but it is asynchronous. The main thread is interrupted due to the exception thrown by asynchronous Skywalking, and the normal logic cannot be completed.
I think skywalking needs to provide jetcd plugin, or need to remove spring related plugin
The `jetcd` is never included in the supported list, AFAIK. We are welcome the contribution from the community.

I think I have explained this very clearly in the other issue you submitted. **We(SkyWalking community) are never `built on` or `for` OT in any case. We provided a bridge, no one wants to follow up, that is all.**
